fokus 0.0.9024

    • FOKUS questionnaire schema

Get variable label

Source: R/fokus.gen.R
v_lbl.Rd

Extracts a variable's (common) label from the questionnaire data.

v_lbl(v_name, ballot_date = NULL, canton = NULL)

Arguments

v_name

Variable name. A character scalar.
ballot_date

NULL or a FOKUS-covered ballot date, i.e. one of

  • "2018-09-23"

  • "2018-11-25"

  • "2019-10-20"

  • "2020-09-27"

  • "2020-10-18"

  • "2021-11-28"
canton

NULL or a canton name, i.e. one of

  • "aargau"

Value

A character scalar.

Details

If no ballot_date and canton are specified, variable_label_common is returned, otherwise variable_label. Note that ballot_date and canton either must both be NULL or set to a valid canton name and ballot date respectively.

See also

Other variable-related functions: is_skill_question_v(), v_lvls(), v_proposal_nr(), v_skill_question_nr()

Examples

# if `ballot_date` and `canton` are not supplied, `variable_label_common` is returned:
fokus::v_lbl("participation_federal")
#> [1] "respondent's participation status regarding the federal proposals/elections of the current ballot (blank votes count as 'participated')"

# otherwise `variable_label`:
fokus::v_lbl(v_name = "participation_federal",
             ballot_date = "2018-09-23",
             canton = "aargau")
#> [1] "respondent's participation status regarding the federal proposals of the current ballot (blank votes count as 'participated')"
            
fokus::v_lbl(v_name = "participation_federal",
             ballot_date = "2019-10-20",
             canton = "aargau")
#> [1] "respondent's participation status regarding the federal elections of the current ballot (blank votes count as 'participated')"
